title: Diabetes Outcomes & Neighborhood Deprivation Study
subtitle: Spatial modeling of SDOH signals to surface community-level risk patterns
summary: A spatial analytics study linking diabetes outcomes with neighborhood deprivation indices to inform public health interventions and resource allocation strategies.

sections.title: Context
sections.text: Public health stakeholders need actionable, location-specific insight into how social determinants of health influence chronic disease outcomes.

sections.title: Problem
sections.text: Quantify and visualize the relationship between diabetes outcomes and deprivation indices to identify high-risk clusters and underserved areas.

sections.title: Approach
sections.text: Built a spatial modeling workflow using neighborhood indices, outcome rates, and geographic covariates. Applied correlation analysis, spatial autocorrelation checks, and risk surface mapping.

sections.title: Evaluation
sections.text: Validated spatial signal stability with sensitivity checks and cross-comparisons across multiple index definitions.

sections.title: Impact
sections.text: Informed community-level intervention thinking and prioritization frameworks for public health planning.

title: Financial Balance-Sheet RAG System (FinBizInfo)
subtitle: Internal AI analyst for ratio extraction, risk flags, and forecasting
summary: Retrieval-augmented system that ingests noisy financial PDFs and returns structured balance-sheet insights with citations and risk indicators.

sections.title: Context
sections.text: Analysts were spending extensive time manually parsing and reconciling financial statements across heterogeneous PDF sources.

sections.title: Problem
sections.text: Automate extraction of ratios, anomalies, and risk flags while preserving traceability to source documents.

sections.title: Approach
sections.text: Implemented a hybrid RAG pipeline with document chunking, structured extraction, and text-to-SQL reasoning for tabular validation. Added agent routing for forecasting and risk summarization.

sections.title: Evaluation
sections.text: Combined RAGAS-style checks with manual QA to validate financial consistency, citation accuracy, and robustness to PDF noise.

sections.title: Impact
sections.text: Reduced manual analysis time by ~60% while standardizing reporting format and auditability.

title: Distributed RAG Microservices (MLOps-Ready)
subtitle: Modular inference services with CI/CD templates
summary: Microservice architecture for deploying retrieval and inference components as reusable modules, enabling faster iteration across AI products.

sections.title: Context
sections.text: AI deployments needed a consistent, reusable architecture for retrieval, inference, and evaluation across multiple projects.

sections.title: Problem
sections.text: Design a modular, MLOps-ready pipeline that decouples retrieval, embedding, and inference layers with clear CI/CD workflows.

sections.title: Approach
sections.text: Defined microservice boundaries, containerized each service, and implemented CI/CD pipelines for automated testing and deployments.

sections.title: Impact
sections.text: Created a reusable template that accelerates future RAG deployments and standardizes observability.

title: County-Wide Digital Access Segmentation (Hennepin County DX + IDA)
subtitle: Resident personas built from ADI/SVI and tech-access proxies
summary: Segmentation framework that blends socioeconomic indices with behavioral signals to guide equitable digital service redesign.

sections.title: Context
sections.text: County leadership needed an evidence-based picture of digital inequity and readiness for AI-enabled services.

sections.title: Problem
sections.text: Identify resident segments with distinct access barriers and translate findings into actionable policy insights.

sections.title: Approach
sections.text: Integrated ADI/SVI scores, device/internet proxies, and service usage patterns; built clustering models and persona narratives.

sections.title: Impact
sections.text: Informed digital service redesign priorities and AI readiness planning across departments.

title: Trend Forecasting & Influence Optimization
subtitle: NLP + Bayesian optimization + RL for campaign virality
summary: A modeling framework that predicts social trend lift and recommends interventions to improve campaign reach and ROI.

sections.title: Context
sections.text: Marketing teams needed early-warning trend signals and a systematic way to optimize influencer or content strategy.

sections.title: Approach
sections.text: Combined NLP feature extraction, time-series forecasting, and reinforcement learning to recommend actions that maximize engagement lift.

sections.title: Impact
sections.text: Delivered a reusable optimization framework for campaign planning and experimentation.

title: Commercial Real Estate Data Pipeline on Azure
subtitle: Automated ingestion and ML-ready normalization for property data
summary: Scalable ETL and data quality workflows that unified multi-source property data and accelerated downstream modeling.

sections.title: Context
sections.text: Property data arrived from multiple sources with inconsistent formats and latency constraints.

sections.title: Approach
sections.text: Built Azure Data Factory pipelines, dbt models, and MongoDB/Azure SQL integration to standardize data and support ML workflows.

sections.title: Impact
sections.text: Improved data acquisition speed by 4Ã— and reduced manual reconciliation workload.

title: Customer Service Experience Dashboard
subtitle: Automated KPI reporting for leadership visibility
summary: Power BI dashboards that automated KPI tracking and improved transparency across customer service teams.

sections.title: Context
sections.text: Leadership needed a single source of truth for service quality, volume, and resolution trends.

sections.title: Approach
sections.text: Built automated data refreshes, standardized KPI definitions, and created interactive dashboards for drill-down analysis.

sections.title: Impact
sections.text: Enabled executive reporting and uncovered operational trends for performance improvement.

title: Sales Analytics Automation (KPMG Collaboration)
subtitle: QlikSense dashboards for faster sales reporting
summary: Automated sales analytics dashboards that improved report turnaround time and data visibility for leadership teams.

sections.title: Context
sections.text: Sales leadership required rapid, consistent insights across product lines and regions.

sections.title: Approach
sections.text: Designed QlikSense dashboards and automated SQL-driven data extracts to support recurring reporting.

sections.title: Impact
sections.text: Boosted reporting efficiency by ~35% and reduced manual Excel dependency.
